solution_line_template: Since a year has {days_in_year} days, if Gavin has been having {dreams_per_day} dreams every day for a year now, he has had {dreams_per_day}*{days_in_year} = <<{dreams_per_day}*{days_in_year}={dreams_this_year}>>{dreams_this_year} dreams this year.

Gavin had twice as many dreams last as he had this year, meaning he had {multiplier_twice}*{dreams_this_year} = <<{multiplier_twice}*{dreams_this_year}={dreams_last_year}>>{dreams_last_year} dreams last year.
The total number of dreams he has had in the two years is {dreams_last_year}+{dreams_this_year}=<<{dreams_last_year}+{dreams_this_year}={total_dreams}>>{total_dreams} dreams.
